channel.title: Granite Crusher
channel.description:
Well...I made this...Then realized it could be used as a granite maul 'upgrade' or something else runescape themed, dont know much of runeskapez so... Im going to need a metaseq colorer, and it stands at 990 poly in quads...so if you do the math, its 1980 poly tri'ed, Here you go. [URL=http://img265.imageshack.us/i/maulerw.png/][IMG]http://img265.imageshack.us/img265/1914/maulerw.png[/img][/URL] [URL=http://img26.imageshack.us/i/mauler2.png/][IMG]http://img26.imageshack.us/img26/9210/mauler2.png[/img][/URL] [URL=http://img831.imageshack.us/i/maulerwire.png/][IMG]http://img831.imageshack.us/img831/7452/maulerwire.png[/img][/URL]
You may wonder why I always post wireframes on my models, I really dont need too, because they are flawless, But its for the modellers still learning how poly should flow.

item.title: Granite Crusher
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

[quote=“Tribbinator, post:31, topic:360275”][quote author=Java Is My Bitch link=topic=456707.msg3343292#msg3343292 date=1284591907]
By the way we’ve gotten rid of the poly limit now, so go wild!
[/quote]

We have? Ooooooh…Awesome, Bwuaha[/quote]

Don’t over do it though. You have to remember Runescape uses 4 point logarithmic which means no matter how much detail you may have, the render will still have less detail.

Read full topic

item.title: Granite Crusher
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch2 Java Is My Bitch
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch2 wrote:

[quote=“Tribbinator, post:28, topic:360275”]Thank you so much for the crits, I havnt had crits in…A while. I see exactly what you mean Java, and I can kind of explain, I would love to sacrifice faces on example B, but I just couldnt in this situation, and for example A, I do model like that on my non-RSPS models which are mainly guns…But I geuss I just always modelled like that for RSPS. With the floating geometry and everything[/quote]
By the way we’ve gotten rid of the poly limit now, so go wild!

Read full topic

@Tribbinator wrote:

I see exactly what you mean Java, and I can kind of explain, I would love to sacrifice faces on example B, but I just couldnt in this situation, and for example A, I do model like that on my non-RSPS models which are mainly guns…But I geuss I just always modelled like that for RSPS. With the floating geometry and everything

item.title: Granite Crusher
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch2 Java Is My Bitch
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch2 wrote:

Yea, let me give you some tips though:

A: You should start to extrude from your base model instead of creating new objects, because it makes the render & the wire frame look funky.
B: You should also start to smooth out these kind of abrupt changes. Care to sacrifice a few faces because of it?

Read full topic

item.title: Granite Crusher
item.dc:creator: @Tribbinator Tribbinator
item.description:
@Tribbinator wrote:

Ahhh I see Let me explain…I was planning to make it alot more detailed, but then I ran into that stupid poly limit wall, and had to delete detail to make it work, I totally understand though, thank you

Read full topic

item.title: Granite Crusher
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch2 Java Is My Bitch
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch2 wrote:

[quote=“Tribbinator, post:23, topic:360275”]Whats up JIMB? Do you just not like me? Because the past couple of comments you have left for me seem unnecessarily critical, Just wondering![/quote]Naw, bro. Just to get you to push your limits. You’re easily one of the best people that are active currently, though I’ve seen your older models, and I liked the way you put a descent amount of detail into your models.
